medical_history.chief_complaint: Feeling unwell for 1 week with evidence of arrhythmia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until around 1 week ago. She fell from a height of 5 feet while placing curtains and began to feel unwell afterward, experiencing diffuse fatigue, weakness, headache, abdominal discomfort, occasional lightheadedness, nausea, and one episode of emesis. Initial symptoms began after the fall, with no prior prodromal symptoms or loss of consciousness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Aortic Valve Stenosis and Insufficiency, Congestive Heart Failure (EF 40%), Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Congenital Complete Heart Block s/p Pacemaker, Apical LV Thrombus, Peptic Ulcer Disease, Osteopenia, and multiple past surgeries (Hysterectomy, Appendectomy, Cholecystectomy, Repair of right rotator cuff tear, Cataract surgery).
medical_history.family_history: There is no family history of premature coronary artery disease or sudden death.
